page.title: 01NANSTALLON AND AREA
page.content: Our area has scattered farms and woodland and the two main places are { {Nanstallon,}meaning valley of the{ {River Allen,}and{Ruthern Bridge.}There are 3 main valleys and some steep slopes.The lanes are often narrow and like leafy tunnels.In summer the fields,with their Cornish banks and no fences,are a patchwork of pasture,barley and woods.There are 107 dwellings.Most old buildings have been modernised.Six houses are empty, including 2 tiny condemned cottages next to the Post Office.Thirty eight have been built in the last 18 years,3 are being built and 2 more are planned.Local councils oppose large scale development,which most villagers do not want.Most homes are owner occupied.There are still cob cottages, but most are built of stone and some are modern concrete block houses.
